alert.note: Alert for Rich (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 04 at 11:04AM MDT until June 07 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: .A combination of continued high elevation snowmelt and upstream dam releases will maintain high flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding along the Bear River from below Woodruff Narrows Reservoir northward to the Utah/Wyoming line west of Sage Junction, Wyoming caused by snowmelt and reservoir releases. * WHERE...Portions of northern Utah and southwest Wyoming, including the following counties, in northern Utah, Rich. In southwest Wyoming, Uinta. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding along the Bear River will continue to impact mainly agricultural areas and low-lying roadways near the Bear River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1102 AM MDT, Gauge and trained spotter reports indicate flooding is ongoing due to snowmelt and reservoir releases. The Bear River is expected to remain high in this area, but flows are on the decline and are anticipated to fall below flood levels later this week. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Randolph and Woodruff.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
